meanings.sent1: The bully gave the poor boy some hard lickings.
meanings.sent2: After the fight, he was left with bruises from the lickings he received.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten got a few playful lickings from its mother.
meanings.sent4: The storm unleashed its fury, delivering punishing lickings to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The warrior emerged victorious, having endured many fierce lickings in battle.

meanings.sent1: She only had a few lickings of ice cream left in the tub.
meanings.sent2: There were only lickings of soup left in the pot.
meanings.sent3: He managed to find some lickings of chocolate at the bottom of the box.
meanings.sent4: The crumbs on the plate were just lickings of the delicious cake.
meanings.sent5: The thief left behind only lickings of evidence at the crime scene.

meanings.sent1: The dog's lickings on my face woke me up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the cat's lickings as it cleaned its fur.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's lickings of the ice cream cone were messy but adorable.
meanings.sent4: The horse's lickings on the salt block showed its need for minerals.
meanings.sent5: The chef's lickings of the spoon indicated the deliciousness of the sauce.
